ygData.subject: Re: Item Value and Use of Deterioration
ygData.msgSnippet: What?  You mean beta is over??  When did this happen???  Seems to me that if you have features that don t work yet, and weekly fixes and updates, that you are
ygData.messageBody:
What? You mean beta is over?? When did this happen??? Seems to me that if
you have features that don't work yet, and weekly fixes and updates, that
you are still IN beta! Decisions are still being made as to characters,
classes, skills, spells, etc... So we really are still in a beta stage...
Actually the former stage should really have been called an Open Alpha stage
(or Beta 1 and we are now in Beta 2? 3? 4?).

It's one thing to fix small bugs that were UNNOTICED before release, and its
another thing to add whole NEW (unplanned for) features and call it an
upgrade... But Verant is still fixing things that do not work properly in
almost every area... Things that they KNEW did not work right when they
released it for sale to the general public... That doesn't mean it's not
still (actually) in beta...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com

> From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
>
> really, a very nice point. I agree with you for the most part. I just wish
> it were practical to code :( It's not only difficult to code, but it
borders
> on 'sweeping changes' that Brad talked about. Now that beta is over, there
> can be no more 'sweeping changes' like there used to be. In beta, that was
> part of playing. Getting used to those changes. That can't happen in the
> commercial release, it's VERY bad business :( I really wish it were
> practical to do this, I like your idea. I just know it can never happen.
We
> can dream, though!!
>
> Rennin auctions, 'Pristine Gold Trim Plate for sale! Will make a full suit
> for 4000 plat!'
>
> -Rennin of E'Ci
